meanings.sent1: He blashed the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She blashed the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef blashed the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm blashed against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent5: The boxer blashed his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.sent1: The blash of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: I heard a blash coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The blash of the fireworks made everyone cheer.
meanings.sent4: The blash of the car horn made me jump.
meanings.sent5: The blash of the cymbals marked the end of the performance.

meanings.definition: To speak in a loud, aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The politician blashed his opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent2: She blashed out her frustrations at her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The teacher blashed instructions to the students to be heard over the noise.
meanings.sent4: His words blashed like thunder, leaving everyone stunned.
meanings.sent5: The coach blashed encouragement to the team during the game.
